intro: Rourea thonneri, commonly known as the velvetleaf rourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
